title: Adaiah
html: ADAIAH(A·daiʹah) [Jehovah Has Decked [the nameholder]].1. A descendant of Levi’s son Gershom and an ancestor of Asaph.—1Ch 6:39-43.2. A Benjaminite, son of Shimei.—1Ch 8:1, 21.3. The father of Maaseiah, who was one of “the chiefs of hundreds” that helped Jehoiada the priest overthrow wicked Athaliah’s rule and set Jehoash upon the throne of Judah.—2Ch 23:1.4. The father of Jedidah, who was the mother of King Josiah. (2Ki 22:1) He was a native of Bozkath, located in the Shephelah in the territory of Judah.—Jos 15:21, 33, 39.5. A son of Joiarib of the tribe of Judah.—Ne 11:4, 5.6. A priest dwelling in Jerusalem after the return from Babylonian exile, the son of Jeroham.—1Ch 9:10-12; Ne 11:12.7. An Israelite, one of the descendants of Bani who divorced their foreign wives and sent away their sons after the Babylonian exile.—Ezr 10:29, 44.8. Another of the Israelites who sent away their foreign wives and sons, his ancestral head being Binnui.—Ezr 10:38, 39, 44.
